info.name: Detect Deprecated XSS Protection Header
author: joshlarsen
info.description: Setting the XSS-Protection header is deprecated by most browsers. Setting the header to anything other than `0` can actually introduce an XSS vulnerability.

request:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: bo.dossierfacile.fr
User-Agent: Nuclei - Open-source project (github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei)
Connection: close
Accept: */*
Accept-Language: en
Accept-Encoding: gzip
response:
HTTP/1.1 302 
Connection: close
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, max-age=0, must-revalidate
Content-Language: en
Date: Thu, 09 Jun 2022 01:37:14 GMT
Expires: 0
Location: https://bo.dossierfacile.fr/login
Pragma: no-cache
Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=AADF1FC7907DB91737C18E04AF7CBF9D; Path=/; Secure; HttpOnly
Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000 ; includeSubDomains
X-Content-Security-Policy: script-src 'self'
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN
X-Request-Id: 3557d063-d861-4efe-b3c8-95cc9e370609
X-Xss-Protection: 1; mode=block
Content-Length: 0
